sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
message_1:
Consider two sets A = {1, 2} and B = {2, 3}. 

a) Find A × B.

b) Find B × A.

c) Find the intersection of A × B and B × A. 

Verify that the result in part (c) shows that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
